alert.note: Alert for Freestone (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 10:50PM CDT until March 24 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Freestone and Limestone. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mexia, Groesbeck, Teague, Fairfield, Fort Parker State Park, Fairfield Lake State Park, Thornton, Kosse and Kirvin.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
